headline: Billionaire Seth Klarman Has 42.8% of His Hedge Fund's $3.5 Billion Equities Portfolio Invested in Just 3 Stocks
summary: Like many of the investing greats, Seth Klarman takes a value approach, in which he tries to find stocks and other assets trading below their intrinsic value and buy them at a discount.  Klarman is a firm believer in the lessons taught by Benjamin Graham, who is widely considered the father of value investing.  Klarman's fund, the Baupost Group, has done quite well, generating annual returns of 20% over the last three decades, according to institutional-investor intelligence service Hedge Fund Alpha.

headline: 3i Group: Action's Business Model Is A No-Brainer
summary: Discover why Action's aggressive expansion and low-priced business model make it a compelling investment despite skepticism about its valuation.

headline: 3 Reasons to Sell DG and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: What a brutal six months it’s been for Dollar General. The stock has dropped 41% and now trades at $77, rattling many shareholders. This was partly driven by its softer quarterly results and might have investors contemplating their next move.
